results.definition: hitting a golf ball off of a tee with a driver
examples: he sliced his drive out of bounds

results.definition: the act of applying force to propel something
examples: after reaching the desired velocity the drive is cut off

results.definition: a journey in a vehicle (usually an automobile)
examples: he took the family for a drive in his new car

results.definition: force into or from an action or state, either physically or metaphorically
examples: He drives me mad

results.definition: have certain properties when driven
examples: My new truck drives well

results.definition: move into a desired direction of discourse
a road leading up to a private house
examples: they parked in the driveway

results.definition: cause to move back by force or influence
strive and make an effort to reach a goal
a series of actions advancing a principle or tending toward a particular end
examples: the team was ready for a drive toward the pennant

results.definition: a wide scenic road planted with trees
examples: the riverside drive offers many exciting scenic views

results.definition: travel or be transported in a vehicle
proceed along in a vehicle
examples: We drive the turnpike to work

results.definition: a mechanism by which force or power is transmitted in a machine
examples: a variable speed drive permitted operation through a range of speeds

results.definition: a physiological state corresponding to a strong need or desire
cause someone or something to move by driving
cause to function by supplying the force or power for or by controlling
examples: The amplifier drives the tube
steam drives the engines
this device drives the disks for the computer

results.definition: cause to move rapidly by striking or throwing with force
examples: drive the ball far out into the field

results.definition: compel somebody to do something, often against his own will or judgment
(computer science) a device that writes data onto or reads data from a storage medium
excavate horizontally
examples: drive a tunnel

results.definition: hit very hard, as by swinging a bat horizontally
examples: drive a ball

results.definition: (hunting) chase from cover into more open ground
examples: drive the game

results.definition: (hunting) search for game
examples: drive the forest

results.definition: move by being propelled by a force
operate or control a vehicle
examples: drive a car or bus
Can you drive this four-wheel truck?

results.definition: push, propel, or press with force
(sports) a hard straight return (as in tennis or squash)
strike with a driver, as in teeing off
examples: drive a golf ball

results.definition: the act of driving a herd of animals overland
the trait of being highly motivated
examples: his drive and energy exhausted his co-workers

results.definition: to compel or force or urge relentlessly or exert coercive pressure on, or motivate strongly
examples: She is driven by her passion

results.definition: urge forward
examples: drive the cows into the barn

results.definition: work as a driver
examples: He drives a bread truck
She drives for the taxi company in Newark
